description: Front porch; installation of pergola at rear (retrospective)
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">The pergola by reason of its inappropriate materials, height, depth, siting and its excessive rearward projection beyond the rear of No.105 Mollison Way, gives rise to an unduly dominant and overbearing form of development, which results in an unacceptable loss of outlook and a sense of enclosure to the rear garden of No.105 Mollison Way. The proposal is contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D7&nbsp;of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:12pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif"><span style="line-height:normal">The pergola, by reason of its excessive bulk, size, scale and inappropriate materials, results in an unsympathetic and contrived form of development. Combined with the existing single storey rear extension it constitutes an overdevelopment of the application site, unduly detracting from its original form and the established pattern of development within the surrounding area. The proposal is contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D11&nbsp;of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></span></span></p>
